Legal_Issue: Violation of procedural fairness and natural justice in refugee claim determination
Governing_Law: Administrative law, principles of procedural fairness
Decision_Level: Immigration and Refugee Board (IRB) / Refugee Protection Division
Evidence_Type: Claimant's fear of residing in Colombo
Basis_of_Claim: Fear of persecution upon return to Sri Lanka (Colombo)
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Failure to allow response to new case law, ignoring relevant evidence
Review_Outcome: Application allowed, decision referred for redetermination
Evidence_Ignored: Evidence regarding claimant's fear of residing in Colombo
Legal_Standard: Procedural fairness, right to make submissions
Decision_Outcome: Refugee claim dismissed initially, then decision overturned on review
Decision_Review_Issue: Whether tribunal violated natural justice by not allowing response to new case law and ignoring evidence
Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness, with elements of correctness for procedural fairness
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Principles of natural justice, procedural fairness under administrative law
Outcome_of_Review: Decision set aside, remitted to a different panel for redetermination
Cause_of_Refusal: Procedural unfairness, lack of opportunity to respond, ignored evidence
Evidentiary_Issues: Relevant evidence about safety concerns in Colombo was disregarded
Procedural_Fairness: Violated: claimant not given chance to respond to new case law
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge based on procedural unfairness and legal error
Jurisdictional_Focus: Canada, Federal Court jurisdiction over immigration decisions
Relevant_Law: Administrative law, Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA)
Procedural_Issue: Denial of right to be heard on new legal authorities
Omission_Type: Failure to consider relevant evidence, failure to invite submissions on new case law
